Thank you (and the others) for the answer. One question, though:

> Here's =
another example:
> The JUnit 3 test runners create all test cases before ru=
nning, and
> keep references to them in memory after running.  Anything kep=
t as field
> references in a test class will not be GC'd until the test run=
ner
> releases the test class reference (which is never).

Doesn't this qua=
lify as a memory leak? Is this a known bug or working
as designed? Mayby I =
didn't understand fully what you meant: when the
TestRunner is done, isn't =
it GC'ed by itself?
